DOC.brief_summary: This study prospective comparative study . The purpose study investigate hypothesis whether remifentanil compare fentanyl induce less inflammatory stress response day-case dental surgery Persons special need ( PSN ) . Secondary aim investigate comparatively effect patient intraoperative hemodynamic response postoperative analgesia .
DOC.detailed_description: The study include 46 adult patient cognitive impairment underwent day-case dental surgery general anesthesia propofol aim keep BIS-values range 40-45 . Nasal tracheal intubation perform patient neuromuscular blockade achieve rocuronium 0.6 mg/kg iv repetitive dos rocuronium 10 mg iv , need . Patients randomly allocate receive intraoperative analgesia either fentanyl 50 μg iv bolus ( group F , n=23 ) continuous infusion remifentanil 0.5-1 μg/kg/min ( group R , n=23 ) . Randomization perform use use computer-generated randomization schedule . Intraoperatively , patient group receive IV granisetron 3 mg , methylprednisolone 125 mg clindamycin 600 mg , atropine 0.02 mg/kg neostigmine ( 0.05 mg/kg ) administer reverse neuromuscular blockade . Intraoperative monitoring include non-invasive measurement arterial blood pressure , electrocardiogram , pulse oxymetry , capnography Bispectral Sedation Index ( BIS® ) . Postoperatively , patient remain surveillance post-anesthesia care unit [ PACU ] 3 h. Postoperative pain assess first 12 postoperative hour , 30 min time-intervals first 3 hour , every 3 hour thereafter independent observer , blind study group , use Wong-Baker face pain rating scale ( 0-6 ) . If pain score ≥3 rescue dose paracetamol 12.5 mg/kg iv administer . Inflammation marker stress hormone [ cortisol , Tumor necrosis factor ( TNF-a ) , substance-P , melatonin β-endorphin ] measure patient induction anesthesia , tracheal intubation end operation . Statistical Analysis perform use Kolmogorov-Smirnov test , Student 's unpaired t-test Repeated Measures ANOVA Holm 's post-hoc analysis appropriately . A p value le 0.05 consider statistically significant .
